paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

# Take will give me a python structure I can iterate through...
flights=flightData2015.take(5)
for flight in flights:
    print "Destination: " + flight.DEST_COUNTRY_NAME

msg.data:
Destination: United States
Destination: United States
Destination: United States
Destination: Egypt
Destination: United States

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

# explain is useful to understand how spark solves our queries:
flightData2015.sort("count").explain()

msg.data:
== Physical Plan ==
*Sort [count#103 ASC NULLS FIRST], true, 0
+- Exchange rangepartitioning(count#103 ASC NULLS FIRST, 200)
   +- *FileScan csv [DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#101,ORIGIN_COUNTRY_NAME#102,count#103] Batched: false, Format: CSV, Location: InMemoryFileIndex[file:/custom/zeppelin/Spark-The-Definitive-Guide/data/flight-data/csv/2015-summ..., PartitionFilters: [], PushedFilters: [], ReadSchema: struct<DEST_COUNTRY_NAME:string,ORIGIN_COUNTRY_NAME:string,count:int>

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

# Setting this property is usefull when working on a small machine such as our notebook.
# There is no point in creating so many partitions if we don't have too many cores and IOPS to 
# process them in parallel. 
spark.conf.set("spark.sql.shuffle.partitions", "5")

# If you look at the generated plan, you will notice that the number of partitions was reduced from 200 to 5:
flightData2015.sort("count").explain()

msg.data:
== Physical Plan ==
*Sort [count#103 ASC NULLS FIRST], true, 0
+- Exchange rangepartitioning(count#103 ASC NULLS FIRST, 5)
   +- *FileScan csv [DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#101,ORIGIN_COUNTRY_NAME#102,count#103] Batched: false, Format: CSV, Location: InMemoryFileIndex[file:/custom/zeppelin/Spark-The-Definitive-Guide/data/flight-data/csv/2015-summ..., PartitionFilters: [], PushedFilters: [], ReadSchema: struct<DEST_COUNTRY_NAME:string,ORIGIN_COUNTRY_NAME:string,count:int>

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

# You can see that the generated plan for direct spark manipulations and SQL is the same:
flightData2015.createOrReplaceTempView("flight_data_2015")
sqlWay = spark.sql("""
select dest_country_name, count(1)
from flight_data_2015
group by dest_country_name
""")

dataFrameWay = flightData2015 \
    .groupBy("DEST_COUNTRY_NAME") \
    .count()
    
sqlWay.explain()
dataFrameWay.explain()

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

from pyspark.sql.functions import desc

moreComplexDFSql = spark.sql("select DEST_COUNTRY_NAME, sum(count) as TOTAL from flight_data_2015 group by DEST_COUNTRY_NAME order by TOTAL Desc limit 5")
moreComplexDFSql.show()

moreComplexDF = flightData2015.groupBy("DEST_COUNTRY_NAME") \
    .sum("count") \
    .withColumnRenamed("sum(count)", "destination_total") \
    .sort(desc("destination_total")) \
    .limit(5)
    
moreComplexDF.show()

msg.data:
== Physical Plan ==
TakeOrderedAndProject(limit=5, orderBy=[TOTAL#389L DESC NULLS LAST], output=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165,TOTAL#389L])
+- *HashAggregate(keys=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165], functions=[sum(cast(count#167 as bigint))])
   +- Exchange hashpartitioning(DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165, 5)
      +- *HashAggregate(keys=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165], functions=[partial_sum(cast(count#167 as bigint))])
         +- *FileScan csv [DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165,count#167] Batched: false, Format: CSV, Location: InMemoryFileIndex[file:/custom/zeppelin/Spark-The-Definitive-Guide/data/flight-data/csv/2015-summ..., PartitionFilters: [], PushedFilters: [], ReadSchema: struct<DEST_COUNTRY_NAME:string,count:int>
== Physical Plan ==
TakeOrderedAndProject(limit=5, orderBy=[destination_total#412L DESC NULLS LAST], output=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165,destination_total#412L])
+- *HashAggregate(keys=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165], functions=[sum(cast(count#167 as bigint))])
   +- Exchange hashpartitioning(DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165, 5)
      +- *HashAggregate(keys=[DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165], functions=[partial_sum(cast(count#167 as bigint))])
         +- *FileScan csv [DEST_COUNTRY_NAME#165,count#167] Batched: false, Format: CSV, Location: InMemoryFileIndex[file:/custom/zeppelin/Spark-The-Definitive-Guide/data/flight-data/csv/2015-summ..., PartitionFilters: [], PushedFilters: [], ReadSchema: struct<DEST_COUNTRY_NAME:string,count:int>
